thread.title: Goff working at point as UTRGV opens practice
thread.title_full: Goff working at point as UTRGV opens practice

author: GREG LUCA, Staff Writer
title: Goff working at point as UTRGV opens practice
text:
Goff working at point as UTRGV opens practice By GREG LUCA, Staff Writer Brownsville Herald 
MISSION — After consecutive seasons as the team’s leading scorer, University of Texas Rio Grande Valley junior Shawnte’ Goff is used to having the ball in her hands. 
So as the Vaqueros head toward the start of the 2015-16 campaign, coach Larry Tidwell is considering streamlining the process, moving Goff to point guard. 
Goff got a taste of the new role Sunday as UTRGV went through its first practice of the season at Sharyland Pioneer High School in Mission. 
“If she buys into it like I think she will, I think she’ll be one of the best point guards in the entire country,” Tidwell said. “She is so explosive.” 
A first-team all-Western Athletic Conference performer last year, Goff ranked third in the conference and best on the then-University of Texas-Pan American team with 14.9 points per game. 
Playing primarily shooting guard and small forward, Goff was the main source of offense for the Broncs. Her 494 shot attempts were 138 more than the team’s next highest total. 
“Last year, I did a lot of driving to the hole, or I’d shoot it,” Goff said. “Lately, I’ve been working on trying to dribble down the floor and pull up. Since I’m a little bit fast, hopefully I can slow it down and get into the rhythm of my shooting.” 
At 5-foot-8 and with a slight build, Goff was somewhat undersized in her 2014-15 role. 
As a point guard, Goff should be able to use her athleticism to generate opportunities in UTRGV’s four-out, one-in offense. 
“With that experience and that speed, I think a lot of good things could happen,” Tidwell said. 
For more on this story, visit MyBrownsvilleHerald.com .
